'Erythrose 4-phosphate' is a phosphate of the simple sugar erythrose. It is an
intermediate in the pentose phosphate pathway and the Calvin cycle.

In addition, it serves as a precursor in the biosynthesis of the aromatic amino
acids tyrosine, phenylalanine, and tryptophan. It is used in the first step of
the shikimate pathway. At this stage, phosphoenolpyruvate and erythrose-4-
phosphate react to form 3-deoxy-D-arabinoheptulosonate-7-phosphate (DAHP), in a
reaction catalyzed by the enzyme DAHP synthase.
